ai_summary: Invalid task dates (e.g., '262025-12-16') cause entire calendar view to fail instead of gracefully skipping the bad task
notes: The calendar view crashes when any task has a malformed date string. The error propagates from parseDate() through createScheduledEvent()/createDueEvent() to buildAllEvents(), which has a catch block that calls failureCallback() - causing the entire calendar to show nothing. Property-based events already have per-entry try-catch that gracefully skips bad dates, but task event generation lacks this defensive handling. The malformed date '262025-12-16' appears to be a data entry issue (likely from the date picker), but regardless of source, the calendar should be resilient to bad data.
root_cause: createScheduledEvent() and createDueEvent() in calendar-core.ts call parseDateToLocal() without try-catch error handling. When a task has an invalid date, the error propagates up to buildAllEvents() which fails the entire event fetch rather than skipping just the problematic task.
suggested_fix: Wrap the task event generation logic (createScheduledEvent/createDueEvent calls in generateCalendarEvents) with try-catch blocks to gracefully skip tasks with invalid dates, similar to how buildPropertyBasedEvents already handles errors per-entry. Optionally log a warning or show a notice to alert users about the problematic task.
fix_summary: Added try-catch block around per-task event generation in generateCalendarEvents() to gracefully skip tasks with invalid dates while logging a warning, allowing other events to display normally.
